newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore shares open flat, new shares top actives.
newsitem.headline: Singapore shares open flat, new shares top actives.

text.p: Singapore shares opened flat on Tuesday but newly-listed Delifrance Asia and Labroy Marine continued to steal the limelight in active trade, dealers said.
Except for these recently listed stocks, sentiment was weak following Monday's weaker than expected September trade data, where non-oil exports fell 6.2 percent year-on-year.
"Recent trade data and news have not been very supportive and this continues to add to market pessimism," one dealer said.
At 0230 GMT, the benchmark Straits Times Industrials Index was at 2,045.89, up 1.66 points. Market volume was meagre at 22 million shares with gainers beating losers by 91 to 45.

Delifrance Asia and Labroy Marine topped the actives, with 3.3 million and 2.9 million shares traded respectively. Both made further gains, with Delifrance at Singapore $0.995 (US$0.71) and Labroy Marine at S$0.965.
OUB Foreign and CityDev were among the gainers, rising S$0.15 and S$0.10 respectively to S$9.50 and S$10.50.
Malaysia's Antah Holding led the losers, shedding S$0.82 to S$1.07 on 10,000 shares.
Some dealers saw the STII hovering around its present level in the near term. They pegged support at 2,030, where a break could lead it to test 2,000-1,900.
